Leaves: Oval to egg-shaped. With usually 7 prominent veins.
Flowers: Large pale pink or whitish, up to 60 cm long.
Habitat: Waterways, wetlands. Native to eastern Australia but has naturalised in other places.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from the significant weed Arrowhead (*Sagittaria calycina*) by having ovalish leaves compared to arrow shaped. Distinguished from Lance leaved water plantain (*Alisma lanceolatum*) in having wider leaves.
Impacts: Note - Native plant except possibly in Qld and Tas.
